item.description: Quick Summary in progress Lecture Videos Lecture 1 Derivatives, slope, velocity, rate of change Lecture 2 Limits, continuity, Trigonometric limits Lecture 3 Derivatives of products, quotients, sine, cosine Lecture Notes Lecture 1 Derivatives, slope, velocity, rate of change Lecture 2 Limits, continuity, Trigonometric limits Lecture 3 Derivatives of products, quotients, sine, cosine Reading Section 1-4 Text 2.1 - 2.6 (p.51 - p. 75) Text 3.

item.title: Change Jekyll to Hugo
item.description: Jekyll had some issue with MD to HTML parser, so we found other static site generator. We considered Hugo and Gatsby, but decided to go with Hugo. There are several reasons why. faster simple less dependency (less plugins though) Template is cleaned and Young made it as Hugo-theme. Bear-exporter (it is named as Pizzly now ü§©) is also applied all differences. Gatsby looks great but seems much similar to Wordpress.

item.title: Inspiration
item.description: Today I read a blog post about success story of self taught. There are a lot of similar stories about being developer, but as mentioned in the post, most of them are mostly focused on the web development and saying about the good courses or useful materials. ‚ÄÉHowever, for me, I‚Äôm gonna focusing on the computer graphics and algorithms, so I just wondered if there are similar cases. This is a one of the case and it‚Äôs very impressive as she studied lots of courses I‚Äôm planning to do.

item.title: Bear notes export to Jekyll posts
item.description: Intro What we‚Äôve done call bear notes from Local DB, and parse them save them as .md for Jekyll posts, and generate pages automatically What we‚Äôve learned How the apple devices are synced Query sqlite3 database by python What we are planning to do further Making simple MacOS app UI using pyQT
